image.altText: An older woman in a grey knitted jumper and an older man in a green flannelette shirt stands in their Earthship.

props.synopsis: Recent widespread power outages in Tasmania had absolutely no effect on Mira and Krsna, who generate their own electricity using solar panels, and only use an estimated 2 kWh per day.

title.children: How an off-grid home kept this couple 'quite comfortable' when thousands were left without power

image.altText: Three women standing in front of a tree.

props.synopsis: More than 50 years on, Robyn Cohen still lives with the pain of having had her baby forcibly given up for adoption. She's one of a number of Tasmanian women affected by the practice who are fighting for compensation.

title.children: 'Finally, we have a voice': Victims of forced adoption practices continue push for compensation

image.altText: Paula Wriedt stands in front of an oval holding a large concept plan

props.synopsis: When Paula Wriedt was elected to the Tasmanian parliament in 1996, a radio interviewer was more interested in her smile than her policies. Cr Wriedt, now a local government mayor, is hopeful the situation for women in politics is improving.

title.children: It can be tough being a woman in politics, but former MP Paula Wriedt says she's enjoying being back in public life

image.altText: Complex of grey buildings behind a fence

props.synopsis: Tasmania's prison service operated a "hostile management regime" within a high security unit at Risdon Prison, Tasmania's Custodial Inspector has revealed.

title.children: Teenage inmate exposes 'unsanctioned' punishment regime in Tasmanian prison

image.altText: A dimly lit pokies room with bright colourful lights coming from each of the machines.

props.synopsis: Former treasurer Michael Ferguson was one of the cashless card's biggest advocates within the government. Now that he's resigned from cabinet, there are fears the government won't stick to its policy announced two years ago.

title.children: Is the Tasmanian government still committed to a cashless gaming card without Michael Ferguson in cabinet?

image.altText: A woman in pink pants crouching next to a preserved Tasmanian Tiger.

props.synopsis: The team behind a bid to 'de-extinct' the Tasmanian tiger says it has made significant breakthroughs, including producing a genome that is 99.9-per-cent accurate. Scientists say the scientific progress is welcome but they want to see the data.

title.children: Tasmanian tiger 'de-extinction' project claims genome breakthrough â€” but other scientists want to see the data

image.altText: A graphic image of a curved three-storey building on a waterfront

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian hotel development locked in a Supreme Court dispute over whether the local council has the right to buy back the land it will be built on will bypass council planning laws to be assessed as a major infrastructure project.

title.children: Did you miss? ðŸ“£ Contentious hotel development at centre of legal debate green-lit as major project

image.altText: Andrew Barr drinks a beer

props.synopsis: The ACT election result is another confirmation of how different Canberra is to the rest of the country, having just voted in a seven-term government, which would almost be impossible in any other jurisdiction.

title.children: If 23 years was considered a 'forever government,' how will the ACT describe Labor after 27?

image.altText: Tim Tszyu and Bakhram Murtazaliev stare off

props.synopsis: Tim Tszyu aims to bounce back from his first career defeat to become a two-time world boxing champion against IBF junior middleweight champion, Bakhram Murtazaliev. Follow live.

title.children: Tim Tszyu faces career-defining world title fight in Orlando

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Tapia vs Saavedra a majority draw!
Kostya Tszyu to walk Tim Tszyu to the ring

image.altText: Donald Trump smiles

props.synopsis: Experts say that while Donald Trump and the Republican party say IVF treatments in the US are not at risk, signs are pointing otherwise.

title.children: These two events have ignited debate over IVF in the US

image.altText: Police man with gun walks near car

props.synopsis: It is not clear if the house was hit, but a spokesperson says neither the prime minister nor his wife were home at the time.

title.children: Israel says drone launched towards Benjamin Netanyahu's house

image.altText: A woman smiles while holding a microphone

props.synopsis: The ABC has projected independent Jacqui Scruby will win the traditionally blue-ribbon electorate, which was thrust into a by-election after Liberal Rory Anon quit parliament in August after being charged with child-sex offences, which he denies.Â

title.children: Jacqui Scruby set to become first teal MP in NSW parliament after snatching Pittwater by-election

image.altText: A TV still of Kitty Flanagan sitting at a desk, wearing glasses and a loose brown suit. She has a bemused expression.

props.synopsis:
Much-loved comedian Kitty Flanagan talks about the hard road to getting her ABC TV sitcom Fisk made, and how the show has taken off both in Australia and overseas.

Â 

Â

title.children: Kitty Flanagan struggled to get Fisk made. Now, the ABC TV show is an international hit

image.altText: Tom Gleeson stands at a podium with a wide mouth and eyes. The Hard Quiz logo is to his left.

props.synopsis: So you think you could beat a Hard Quiz contestant? Prove it. It's time to play, HARD!Â

title.children: Like your Sunday coffee with a side of shame? I've got the quiz for you

image.altText: Liam Payne photographed in Paris in March 2024.

props.synopsis: Former One Direction singer Zayn Malik says the dates for the US leg of his Stairway to the Sky tour will be rescheduled for January.

title.children: Zayn Malik postpones tour after death of Liam Payne

image.altText: A close up of a child's hands holding a mobile phone, with a game on the screen. In the background is a computer keyboard.

props.synopsis: For many people, smartphones are an essential part of life, but in the city of St Albans, some parents have pledged to keep them out of their children's hands until they turn 14.Â

title.children: This small UK community noticed kids with 'TikTok brain'. Giving them a 'brick phone' could be the solution

image.altText: A row of guns lined up in a collector's home.

props.synopsis: The Pacific nation's gun amnesty coincided with the shooting death of a 12-year-old child â€” just one week after the alleged murder of a police officer.

title.children: 'Take my gun, take me with it': Samoa's gun amnesty sees limited success

image.altText: a young man in a white t-shirt

props.synopsis: Scientists have developed tiny biological bridges, each made up of millions of nasal cells, which they hope will encourage nerve cells to regenerate and grow over a patient's spinal cord injury.

title.children: Human trial to treat patients paralysed by spinal injury with cells transplanted from their nose

image.altText: Early voting Queensland

props.synopsis: With so many Queenslanders now opting to vote early, it doesn't make sense for the political parties to wait until the home stretch of the election campaign to unveil their major initiatives.

title.children: Go hard, go early: Big pre-poll voting numbers changing how parties campaign

image.altText: A ruler hitting a hand.

props.synopsis: Katter's Australian Party candidates vow to "bring back the smack" as they campaign on youth crime ahead of the Queensland state election.

title.children: Katter party candidates campaign to bring back corporal punishment for children

image.altText: a needle in the sand

props.synopsis: A criminal lawyer in the state's far north says clients with methamphetamine addiction on remand or bail have been left with no treatment options, amid concerns the drug's use Â in the region has reached dire proportions.

title.children: Addicts left with 'nowhere' to go amid 'disastrous levels' of methamphetamine use in WA

image.altText: Black and white portrait of bearded Bram Stoker posing in an arm chair

props.synopsis: Gibbet Hill â€” set in a notorious crime hotspot in the English countryside and published as Bram Stoker was beginning work on Dracula â€” is rediscovered by an amateur historian passing the time in the National Library of Ireland.

title.children: Amateur historian turns up long-lost story by Dracula author Bram Stoker

image.altText: Orphaned Brushtail Possum wrapped in a blanket.

props.synopsis: A horror Sunday saw the service field 894 calls for help, prompting requests for increased government support.

title.children: Wildlife Victoria records most calls for assistance in 35-year history

image.altText: Man driving sprayer

props.synopsis: WA sprayer operator Rob Mitchell says a growing number of drivers are mistakenly interpreting his signal to turn right as an opportunity to pass him, with dangerous consequences.

title.children: An unwritten 'country code' is putting Rob's life at risk on the road, and all he's doing is turning right

image.altText: A man with dark hair and goatee poses in casual clothes

props.synopsis: Dr Zimbardo is remembered for an ill-fated 1971 prison study in which he recruited college-aged males to spend two weeks in a mock prison in the basement of a building on the Stanford campus.

title.children: Stanford Prison Experiment creator Philip G Zimbardo dies

image.altText: Auckland FC fans wave black and blue flags and release blue smoke during an A-League Men game.

props.synopsis: Between Auckland FC's first-up win over Brisbane, and the Sydney derby featuring the debuts of Juan Mata and Douglas Costa, 50,000 fans turn up across two A-League Men games either side of the Tasman.

title.children: A-League sell-outs either side of the ditch as Auckland debuts and stars arrive in Sydney derby

image.altText: A man in a green shirt standing next to a box of potatoes

props.synopsis: More than 40 per cent of Gary Kadwell's property is dedicated to revegetation after he planted tens of thousands of trees across his property. It is a move that has seen him save thousands of dollars and improve production levels.Â

title.children: These farmers are saving tens of thousands of dollars for helping the planet

image.altText: A man in a suit with glasses and a suit

props.synopsis: The Coalition's first major housing policy announcement ahead of the election promises $5 billion to fast-track water and roads to speed up the construction of 500,000 new housing developments.

title.children: Dutton's $5 billion plan to speed up construction of outer-suburban housing developments

image.altText: A search and rescue helicopter hovers above a large lake.

props.synopsis:
Police have recovered the bodies of a woman and two children from the Georges River in Sydney's south-west, after the trio were seen in distress earlier in the day.Â 

Â

title.children: Woman and two children found dead in river in Sydney's south-west

image.altText: Large man in Akubra, white and blue shirt,  writes on an ipad, leans on cattle rail. Five men stand on a steel platform.

props.synopsis: With a front-row seat to the Australian cattle market for more than 30 years, Trevor Hess loves reporting on its highs and lows.

title.children: As a boy, Trevor skipped school to watch auctioneers sell cattle. Then he made it his career

image.altText: A person walks in the dark on a street.

props.synopsis: Cuba's electrical grid has collapsed for the second time in just hours, according to state-run media, blacking out the entire country.

title.children: Nationwide blackouts hit Cuba

image.altText: India batter Rishabh Pantcompletes his swing while down on one knee during a Test against New Zealand.

props.synopsis: Rishabh Pant shows once again he is one of international cricket's great entertainers with a mammoth six out of the ground before falling for 99 in a disastrous collapse for India against New Zealand.

title.children: 'Out of the park': Rishabh Pant smacks 107m six before India collapses against New Zealand

image.altText: A man and two women are standing in a dusty paddock, under a sunny sky. Their hands are out patting the white herd of goats

props.synopsis: When the Jessen family lost their major milk processor, they were able to pivot but they want to see more industry representation across the country.Â

title.children: Dairy goat farmers confident in future despite lack of industry representation
